Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`Build -> Archive` command hangs, "Please ensure that you are using a release configuration and that "Use Shared Mono Runtime" option unchecked."" (#1760) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Set a project to release and build, and then Build -> Archive

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
Create an archive
### Actual Behavior
It never completes.

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33150084/40775792-82015028-64fb-11e8-9d21-cfe709a4d25e.PNG)

I'm using release configuration and "Use Shared Mono Runtime" option is unchecked
```
    <BundleAssemblies>true</BundleAssemblies>
    <AotAssemblies>false</AotAssemblies>
```
This is my release configuration. I know this options are not available in the community verison of VS2017, but I can change it manually and reloade the project. It used to compile ok in April and earlier. I'm not sure if something changed in recent VS update.

### Version Information
15.7.1

1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

Events.RelatedBody:

1. Upload a large `byte[]` with `MultipartFormDataContent`
2. HTTP and SSL settings are all set to `Default`

The web request succeeds.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] AndroidCodegenTarget=XAJavaInterop1" (#1774) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
When `$(AndroidCodegenTarget)`=XAJavaInterop1, `generator` output uses
`Java.Interop.JniPeerMembers` for JNI member invocations instead of
the legacy `Android.Runtime.JNIEnv` methods.

This has a number of benefits, such as:

  * Reduced memory use (less garbage generated)
  * Smaller assemblies.
  * Faster `base.Method()` invocations.
  * Improved `jmethodID` caching of Java Callable Wrapper constructors
    for type subclasses.

The problem?  Assemblies built under `XAJavaInterop1` cannot run on
Xamarin.Android 6.0 and earlier.

Xamarin.Android 6.0 was over 2.5 *years* ago.  We do not consider this
to be a signifiant concern, while the *memory and performance
benefits* are significant.

Update the default `$(AndroidCodegenTarget)` value to `XAJavaInterop1`.

If this is undesirable, projects can set the `$(AndroidCodegenTarget)`
MSBuild property to `XamarinAndroid` for the previous behavior.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Enhancement] Ability to set TextColor on TableSection" (#2910) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
It would be nice to set TextColor for TableSection, like so:

```
<TableView Intent="Menu">
     <TableRoot>
          <TableSection Title="Test Section" TextColor="#FFFFFF">
                <TextCell Text="Test Item" TextColor="#FFFFFF"/>
          </TableSection>
     </TableRoot>
</TableView>
```
That's needed so it's possible to better distinguish TableSection and ViewCell (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32224617/how-to-set-textcolor-xamarin-forms-tablesection), especially on Android.
Currently, it's possible via custom renderers, but it's a bit hacky.

Having this out of the box would be nice.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Enhancement] Ability to set BackgroundColor for ViewCell" (#2909) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
It would be nice to have BackgroundColor property on ViewCell.

E.g. when using TableView, section headers and items both have the same background color on Android, making them difficult to distinguish. 

There's  open source project xfgloss that adds missing properties, but it currently has an issue with Android: https://github.com/tbaggett/xfgloss/issues/29

It would be nice to have this functionality out of the box.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Tizen on macOS" (#2907) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi guys,
Has anyone had any success running Xamarin.Forms.Tizen on macOS?

I read this article:
https://blog.xamarin.com/add-tizen-projects-xamarin-forms-apps/

It sounds really promising and it mentions that I need an addin for VS Mac but I am really loat with lack of documentation.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Entry and Picker Shrinked in TableView" (#2906) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
The Picker and Entry are cut off when I stack them with a label in a view cell. I used the Grid and StackLayout to stack them as I could but the edges of the Entry and the Picker still cutoff as shown on the screenshot. This happens exactly when I set the margins of the controls (Any margin be it top, bottom, left... result in the right edge of the picker or the entry to be cutoff). 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a table view and a table section in it
2. Add a view cell to this section, and place a container which can contain the picker or the Entry with the label in it.
3. Stack the controls (Label and (Picker or Entry) horizontally
4. Set a margin property to the container
5. Run on __UWP__
### Expected Behavior
The label should stack horizontally perfectly with the picker or the Entry as it does normally.

### Actual Behavior
 the picker or textview are cut off at the edge on any screen size.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms 3.0.0.482510
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VisualStudio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- UWP -->
  - iOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android: <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP:  16299 
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms 3.0.0.482510
- Affected Devices: UWP

### Screenshots

![xfissue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16731017/40874491-e5786494-6667-11e8-907e-744d3421ab88.PNG)


### Reproduction Link

`<TableSection>`
                        `<ViewCell>`
                            `<StackLayout Orientation="Horizontal"`
                                        ` Margin="5">`
                                `<Label Text="Result"/>`
                                `<Entry />`
                            `</StackLayout>`
                        `</ViewCell>`
                    `</TableSection>`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Trying to deploy a andriod app to the simualtor fails. With a standard libary with entity framework core." (#2905) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
I have been trying to use xamrain with a simple model for years now and every other release it seems to get worse than better, Please guys make this my goto development tools for andriod and ios please.
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Xamrian Forms app add an existing .net standard core libary with ef core 2.02 to the app.
 
### Expected Behavior
App to launch and show data from dl core libary
### Actual Behavior

Project will not even build with this version and deploy to the simliautor.

### Basic Information

Android application is debugging.
Could not connect to the debugger.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Android] `Layout.Childred.Clear()` causes a System.NullReferenceException" (#2834) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

`Layout.Childred.Clear()` causes a `System.NullReferenceException`

Exception:

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object. occurred

  at XFBug.Portable.TestPage.SetView (Xamarin.Forms.View view) [0x00001] in C:\Development\temp\XFBug\XFBug.Portable\TestPage.cs:33 
  at XFBug.Portable.TestView.ButtonClicked (System.Object sender, System.EventArgs e) [0x0000d] in C:\Development\temp\XFBug\XFBug.Portable\TestView.cs:34

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[UWP] NRE inside new SPAN code when setting Text Decorations on UWP" (#2901) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
This issue was initially highlighted by
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/pull/2221#issuecomment-393916685

I created a branch here from master to demonstrate the issue in isolation from the PR
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/tree/span_crash_uwp_text_decorations

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  From run the UWP Control Gallery project from https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/tree/span_crash_uwp_text_decorations

### Expected Behavior
Text Decorations are applied and no crash occurs 

### Actual Behavior
UWP crashes

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Master branch as of https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/tree/span_crash_uwp_text_decorations
- Last known good version: 3.1 pre 1

### Reproduction Link
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/tree/span_crash_uwp_text_decorations

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Your mono runtime and class libraries are out of sync message while building unittest projects with XI master" (#4174) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update System with Xamarin.iOS project, XI version: 11.11.0.331 (master: 238eb94c) 
2. Build and Run any unit test on device.

### Expected Behavior
Build Log should not contain any out of sync messages.

### Actual Behavior
"Your mono runtime and class libraries are out of sync" message is  present in build logs.

### Environment

```
Operating System: Mac OS X 10.13.4
Bot Name: XQA-XI-Sierra-6
Mono version: 5.14.0.106 (820bff26b3b)  (2018-05-25 17:29:19 -04:00)
XA version: 8.3.99.19 (HEAD/09df99bdc) 
XI version: 11.11.0.331 (master: 238eb94c) 
XM version: 4.5.0.331 (master: 238eb94c)  (2018-05-25 07:47:00 -04:00)
XVS version: 
XS version: 7.6.0.971 (e936c76)  (2018-05-28 12:49:41 -04:00)
```

### Build Logs

http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-c8b3a0e9db67473ebe1ff9df22e7c44d.txt, with mono 5.14
http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-641ce6bd5c0545618ad5b7f981fcbbdf.txt with mono 5.12

### Example Project (If Possible)

Any unit test project in xamarin-macios/tests/ folder. 

## Additional Info:
This is not a new issue in master. It was happening for quite sometime. I confirmed that QA tests are checking out the correct external/mono and build logs are not giving false results, also checked manually. This issue is occurring in bots with either mono 5.14 or 5.12 installed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin.iOS should remove references to bugzilla" (#4173) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
There are several references to bugzilla in our source, docs and error messages.  We should audit the hits and change where appropriate.  

https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/search?q=%22bugzilla%22&unscoped_q=%22bugzilla%22

For example...

### Expected Behavior
`Xamarin.iOS: Internal consistency error, please file a bug (https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/new). Additional data: found managed object 0x1275a8ea8=0x7f92d401e080 (Linker.Sealer.Unsealable) in native object 0x600000222c20 (AppDelegate).`

### Actual Behavior
`Xamarin.iOS: Internal consistency error, please file a bug (http://bugzilla.xamarin.com). Additional data: found managed object 0x1275a8ea8=0x7f92d401e080 (Linker.Sealer.Unsealable) in native object 0x600000222c20 (AppDelegate).`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[msbuild] Change MtouchHttpClientHandler default" (#4172) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody: If the Http Client value isn't set in the csproj, we should default to `NSUrlSessionHandler` which is also what the Xamarin.iOS Analysis rules try to enforce.
